data.title: Belgian Players Abroad Archives
data.text:
Belgian Players Abroad

Andy Van Vliet wins Polish Championship with Trefl Sopot

28 year old Belgian Forward/Center Andy Van Vliet has crowned himself champion of the Polish First Division last night as he helped his team Trefl Sopot to a 4-3 win in the best of 7 final series against King Szczecin. In what turned out to be a very hard-fought battle in which Trefl Sopot was…

Belgian Players AbroadNBA

Thijs De Ridder declares for 2024 NBA Draft !

21 year old Power Forward Thijs De Ridder has officially declared for the 2024 NBA Draft, making him the second Belgian player next to Ajay Mitchell to make himself available for the draft. De Ridder’s basketball career has been on a steady rise ever since he first tied his basketball sneakers at the age of…

Belgian Players Abroad

Francis Torreborre records triple-double!

Francis Torreborre seems to have found his home in Switzerland. After bouncing around several European basketball leagues these past couple of seasons (Italy, Austria & Czech Republic), the 29 year old explosive guard now seems to have found his place in Switzerland as he’s now in his second season with Winterthur. He joined the squad…

Belgian Players Abroad

Montpellier beats Villeneuve D’Ascq in playoffs, Julie Allemand named MVP of the game (VIDEO)

Montpellier beats Villeneuve D’Ascq in the first leg of the LFB playoffs (77-83) , Julie Allemand was, once again, named MVP of the game. After winning the French cup, Montpellier, with Julie Allemand and coach Thibaut Petit, played in playoff against Villeneuve d’Ascq this Tuesday. And once again, Julie Allemand was doing it all in…

Belgian Players Abroad

Sam Van Rossom lifts Valencia past Estudiantes with six three-pointers (VIDEO)

Sam Van Rossom lifts Valencia past Estudiantes with six three-pointers in the Liga ACB. If Valencia is eliminated from the Euroleague, they are still in the run for the Liga ACB title. With Madrid, Barcelona or Baskonia it won’t be an easy task. Yesterday against Estudiants, Sam Van Rossom had his highest scoring game of…

Belgian Players Abroad

Stellar performance from Manu Lecomte in Lithuania (VIDEO)

Stellar performance from Manu Lecomte in Lithuania with CBet Prienai. Manu Lecomte is the leader of his team in Lithuania. This week-end, he was the only foreigner of his team. With more pressure on his shoulder, he didn’t disappoint. Against Pieno žvaigždės, he played 35 minutes where he recorded 27 points (five 3 pointers), 5…

Belgian Players Abroad

Maxime De Zeeuw won the Balkan League

Maxime De Zeeuw won the Balkan League on Thursday evening with Hapoel Holon. Holon defeated the Bulgarians of Plvodiv (91-75). The Belgian Lions recorded 13 points, 3 rebounds, 2 assists and 1 steal. It’s his first trophy with Hapoel Holon. After a bad first half, Holon reacted well in the last quarter to win the…

Belgian Players Abroad

Hans Vanwijn shines as Dijon beats Chalons-Reims (VIDEO)

Hans Vanwijn shines again in France as Dijon beats Chalons-Reims in Jeep Elite. After the loss in the French Cup final against ASVEL and Ismael Bako, Dijon played yesterday at Chalons-Reims. And the MVP of the game was Hans Vanwijn. The former Antwerp Giants player had anothter big game with 20 points (8-8 shooting, with…

Belgian Players Abroad

Emma Meesseman wins the Russian title for the 6th time

Emma Meesseman wins the Russian title for the 6th time, with Ekaterinburg. Emma Meesseman conquered, with Ekaterinburg, her 6th title of Russian champion of her career.After the Euroleague, Ekaterinburg defeated Dynamo Kursk on Tuesday 71-91 for the 3rd time in 3 leg of the Russian final. This is the 13th Russian title in a row…
